column4: How can i migrate my settings for pidgin, xchat-gnome and epiphany from mandriva to ubuntu
backup the .program name directories from your home directory
I copied the directories .purple .gnome2/epiphany and .xchat-gnome to my ubuntu-home. Then i set permissions according to standards (ubuntuuser:ubuntuser and chmod 770) but it does not work
none of the programs noticed at all?
I shutdown all programs before i did this, but none of these even dared to use the changed files
where exactly did you put the files
Strange enough, the files did not change after restarting said programms, any idea?
i copied them from /mdv/home/jonny into /home/jonny because both users have the same username but not the same UID, so i had to copy them as root.
Afterwards i issued commands: chown -R jonny:jonny /home/jonny and chmod -R 770 /home/jonny
that is odd, if you start pidgin and configure an account what happens to the files you copied in?
I checked it out now. The old file gets deleted. But the permissions on the new file are exactly the same. So is the version of pidgin in Mandriva and Ubuntu
well, pidgin uses XML for config files so it should be fairly straightforward to create the config files and then copy and paste your old setup into them
Maybe i am being tricked. I just deleted the new config and recopied the migrated one, it now works. This is really kinda odd
maybe pidgin wrote something to gconf when you created the account and is not looking in the right place for your data
i try to at least change a bit in the configurations of each program, then i'll try backing up and migrate the files from mandriva once again. thx for help, good bye
ok, good luck, sorry i couldn't help more
No problem, i'll come back with more questions later :)
